column4: I want to remove Gnome environment and installing kde just customizing ubuntu 10.10. Can anyone suggest me please?
Better off installking kubuntu. But if you still want to give it a shot, just choose to install the KDE environment from synaptic.
and how to remove complete gnome?
Install Kubuntu. It'll be way easier than dealing with the removal of Gnome.
actually i do not have much idea about kbuntu that if i miss anything in kubuntu
any different ubuntu 10.10 and kubuntu 10.10?
and will i get everything of ubuntu in kubuntu?
Not entirely. But a lot of things for Ubuntu are gnome-specific.
yeah but such will i miss such as server,database,networking software?
It's your best bet to try out kubuntu for the best KDE experience. Some applications in Ubuntu will break using Gnome apps unless there are KDE-supported Gnome applications.
i am worry if i miss very nice tools of ubuntu in kubuntu. Will it?
We're just trying to say, you are better off trying Kubuntu for Ubuntu+KDE so you don't break Ubuntu trying to remove Gnome in favor for KDE.
Will i able to install all tools of ubuntu in kubuntu?
Some, maybe. Like Firefox.
ok
Just download Kubuntu from kubuntu.com, burn it to CD and boot from CD.
I find Gnome menu editing very easy too. Can you explain why you want to make the switch?
also needs to be more specific with what applications for Gnome he wants to carry over into KDE.
can you tell me  about uck?
yea all thing
there is a option for kde env (Just i wanna customize my ubuntu)
Nope.
I was made a iso file after installed kde in ubuntu(and i also added my 1.5 gb compiled software)But i was took 2.5 gb and remastersys did not make it properly
there is a package "kde-full". Will it do?
